stem: The patient's estimated Glomerular Filtration Rate (eGFR) has significantly decreased from 90 mL/min/1.73 m² to 45 mL/min/1.73 m². This indicates a decline in renal function, classifying the patient as having Stage {}.

itemContext.sbar: Patient is a 68-year-old male admitted for fatigue and decreased urine output. History of hypertension and diabetes. eGFR has declined significantly. Concerns for worsening renal function.

rationale.correct: 3 Chronic Kidney Disease (CKD). A GFR between 30-59 mL/min/1.73 m² indicates Stage 3 CKD.
rationale.incorrect: 5 CKD indicates GFR < 15 mL/min/1.73 m² or end-stage renal disease (ESRD). The patient's GFR is higher than this range.
clinicalPearls: eGFR is the best overall index of kidney function.
CKD staging is based on eGFR values.
Early recognition and management of CKD can slow progression.

questionTrap.description: Students may confuse the staging of CKD if they do not accurately correlate the eGFR value with the corresponding stage.
questionTrap.trap: Many students may select Stage 2 because they see the eGFR decreasing, but fail to check the EXACT value and apply the staging criteria.
questionTrap.preventativeAction: Encourage students to memorize the CKD staging criteria and to double-check the lab values provided.

mnemonic.mnemonicPhrase: 1 is Fine (GFR >90), 2 is Getting There (GFR 60-89), 3 is a Worry (GFR 30-59), 4 Needs More (GFR 15-29), 5 Needs Life Support (GFR <15)
mnemonic.mnemonicPurpose: To help remember the eGFR ranges associated with each CKD stage.
